org.ardenus.list

Class ConcurrentLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.list.ConcurrentLoop

  • public final class ConcurrentLoop
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to handle Array loops to prevent a ConcurrentModificationException.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • add

        public static <T> void add(java.util.List<T> loop,
                           T obj,
                           boolean allowDuplicates)
        Adds a value to the specified List if it is not currently looping. If it is looping, the value is stored for later when the loop has ended.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type that goes into the specified List.
        Parameters:
        loop - the List to add the value to.
        obj - the value to add to the List.
        allowDuplicates - true if duplicate values are allowed, false otherwise.

      • add

        public static <T> void add(java.util.List<T> loop,
                           T obj)
        Adds a value to the specified List if it is not currently looping. If it is looping, the value is stored for later when the loop has ended.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type that goes into the specified List.
        Parameters:
        loop - the List to add the value to.
        obj - the value to add to the List.

      • remove

        public static <T> void remove(java.util.List<T> loop,
                              T obj)
        Removes a value from the specified List if it is not currently looping. If it is looping, the value is stored for later when the loop has ended.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type that goes into the specified List.
        Parameters:
        loop - the List to remove the value from.
        obj - the value to remove from the List.
